description:
If I have

[conductor]
workers = 0

I get 1 conductor process

Increasing the value I get the following 

workers = 1 = 1 process
workers  = 2 = 3 processes
workers = 3 = 4 processes

Looks like if workers > 1 processes = workers + 1

workers < 2 = processes = 1

This is in Juno and has changed (again) from Icehouse.
title: conductor workers count doesn't respect config

comments.content:
Here's the sequence in the code:
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/juno/nova/openstack/common/service.py#L496
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/juno/nova/cmd/conductor.py#L45
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/juno/nova/service.py#L435

Essentially if workers is 0 or 1, no child workers are started. So you have just one conductor process.

If workers is more than 1 (say 3), then the parent starts as many workers specified, say 3 workers, so you will see a parent + 3 children.

Let's take yet another case i have not specified any workers in my conf, so it picks up the numbers of processors which is 8 and then you will see 9 process(es), i.e. 1 parent and 8 workers!

stack@dims-ubuntu:~$ ps -ef | grep nova-cond

stack    31794 31682  0 Mar24 pts/20   00:00:01 /usr/bin/python /usr/local/bin/nova-conductor --config-file /etc/nova/nova.conf

Hope this helps, if this is not what you see, then please holler.
